column4: i need help when my pc boot while loading the /etc/init.d i get permission denined
did you at any point try to edit something in that folder?
Okay.  This happened to me once when I changed the permissions on a file while trying to edit it.  Hmm.
go to /etc/init.d and 'ls -lo'.  Look for any lines that don't start with "-rwxr-xr-x 1 root"
It's the same way on my system.  Hmm.
Uh, I don't know if this will work, but try going to /var/log and posting the contents of dmesg to pastebin

seeing the exact error might help somebody, and might not.  I can't imagine why it would give you permissions trouble if the permissions are okay, unless something horribly unpleasant happened to root's permissions
Huh.  Thought the error would appear on that.
how do i veiw abd edit my partition tables
